algorithms: Selective Tree Augmented Naive Bayes with Discarding (STAND)
Selective Forest Augmented Naive Bayes with Discarding (SFAND)
ml_techniques.novel_approaches: The study proposes the use of 15 different Bayesian Network (BN) classifiers, including various Augmented Naive Bayes classifiers and General Bayesian Network classifiers, which are compared to other popular machine learning techniques. The Markov blanket principle for feature selection is also investigated.
preprocessing: Discretization of continuous features using the algorithm of Fayyad and Irani
Removal of attributes exhibiting zero variance
Removal of observations with logically incorrect values (e.g., total line count of zero)
Discretization of error count into a Boolean value
Stratified sampling to partition datasets into training and test sets
